Making C++ Fun, Safe, and Accessible – Jason Turner - C++ on Sea 2022
Slides: https://github.com/philsquared/cpponsea-slides/tree/master/2022 

C++ has a reputation for being hard to learn with annoying errors and easy to invoke memory errors that make it dangerous.
Can we make C++ fun and safe and accessible to a larger audience? 
We'll discuss some ideas for what "fun, safe, and accessible" means and how these goals might be accomplished.
--- 

Jason Turner 

Host of C++Weekly on YouTube, Co-host of CppCast, author and curator of the forkable coding standards document http://cppbestpractices.com, author of the first ever C++ Puzzle Books. 
---

C++ on Sea is an annual C++ and coding conference, in Folkestone, in the UK. The 2022 conference was conducted as a two part, physical and online C++ event.
- Annual C++ on Sea,  C++ conference: https://cpponsea.uk/
- 2022 Program: https://cpponsea.uk/2022/schedule/
